channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DNC pays $1.6 million more for Kamala Harris' campaign debt
item.description: The Democratic National Committee paid $1.6 million in September to cover debt from Kamala Harris ' 2024 campaign — bringing the DNC's total payout to...

item.title: Man arrested after crashing into White House security gate: Secret Service
item.description: A man drove a vehicle into the U.S. Secret Service vehicle gate outside the White House on Tuesday night before being arrested, the USSS said. The big...

item.title: Americans are still buying things, bad economic vibes or not
item.description: Consumers are buying higher-priced drinks, pickup trucks and more — a signal from corporate America that the economy appears to be chugging along just...

item.title: Putin's war is "not just about Ukraine," says Estonian ambassador
item.description: Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine is "not only about territory" but also about rewiring global norms and "reestablishing a Russian vision of how th...

item.title: Republicans may have run out of time on ACA tax credit changes
item.description: It may already be too late to implement certain changes Republicans are insisting on as a condition for renewing to Affordable Care Act subsidies, fur...

item.title: Shooting by ICE officer in Los Angeles wounds motorist, U.S. marshal
item.description: Federal authorities said the driver had threatened officers with a vehicle while trying to flee an arrest.

item.title: University of Virginia nears deal with Trump officials to end investigations
item.description: The talks come months after University of Virginia President James E. Ryan resigned amid pressure from the Justice Department.

item.title: Maine Senate hopeful says he’ll remove tattoo ex-aide calls anti-Semitic
item.description: A Jewish civil rights group said the tattoo resembled a Nazi symbol. ‘I have legitimately dedicated much of my life to antifascism,’ Democrat Graham P...

item.title: Former GOP senator John Sununu announces bid for old seat in New Hampshire
item.description: Sununu is aiming to replace retiring Sen. Jeanne Shaheen in a race in which his party hopes to replace a Democrat with a Republican.

item.title: How Obama maneuvered behind the scenes to fight Trump on redistricting
item.description: The ex-president’s involvement reflects the deep anxieties he has about Trump’s agenda and has propelled him into a more political, public-facing role...

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
